Detailed Description

Obsolete - the class Menu, which uses the MenuAccessor, has been replaced by the classes ItemMenu and ItemTree.

The MenuAccessor is an abstract class which represents one menu level and gives access to its corresponding menu items. The following pure virtual methods must be implemented by derived classes:

  • AbstractMenuAccessor::First()
  • AbstractMenuAccessor::Next() Also at least one of the methods:
  • MenuAccessor::GetItemText()
  • MenuAccessor::GetItemIcon() must be overwritten to return the a text or an icon for an item.

The menu-accessor automatically does a horizontal scrolling of the text, if an item is selected and does not fit into the available width.

Draws the menu item.

Parameters:

draw_rect Rectangle which describes the area where to draw the menu item.
highlighted TRUE, if the menu item to be drawn is the currently selected one.

AbstractMenuAccessor * MenuAccessor::GetChild (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Returns:
Pointer to the child MenuAccessor representing the submenu. Return 0 if the current menu item has no submenu.

Reimplemented in AbstractActionMenuAccessor.

Number of columns.

Reimplemented from AbstractMenuAccessor.

XYDIM MenuAccessor::GetItemHeight (   )  const [virtual]
 

If no item-height has been set by SetItemHeight(), the height of the current menu-font is returned. Otherwise the height set by SetItemHeight() is returned.

Implements AbstractMenuAccessor.

const BitmapRes * MenuAccessor::GetItemIcon (  BOOLEAN  highlighted  )  [virtual]
 

Returns the item-icon for the currently iterated item. The input-parameter highlighted indicates, whether the item is highlighted. Per default 0 is returned, hence this method should be overwritten when an icon is needed.

Reimplemented in AbstractActionMenuAccessor.

const WCHAR * MenuAccessor::GetItemText (  BOOLEAN  highlighted  )  [virtual]
 

Returns the item-text for the currently iterated item. The input-parameter highlighted indicates, whether the item is highlighted. Per default 0 is returned, hence this method should be overwritten when a text is needed.

Reimplemented in AbstractActionMenuAccessor.

void MenuAccessor::OnTrigger (  INT  selected_idx  )  [protected, virtual]
 

This method will be called every time a menu item with no submenu has been triggerd.

Parameters:
selected_idx Index of the currently selected menu item.

Reimplemented in AbstractActionMenuAccessor, and ActionMenuAccessor.

void MenuAccessor::SetItemHeight (  XYDIM  item_height  )  [inline]
 

Sets the height of an item in pixels. If a value <= 0 is used, GetItemHeight() returns the height of the current menu-font.
